publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1850 Pauline McNeill: Effect of Sanctions Against Iraq—That the Parliament notes the Amnesty International Report which states that sanctions imposed against Iraq by the UN Security Council in 1990 have crippled Iraq's economic infrastructure, increased unemployment, raised malnutrition and mortality levels and caused widespread corruption throughout Iraqi society; further notes UNICEF estimates that sanctions have contributed to the deaths of approximately 500,000 children under the age of 5 since 1990, and calls on the UN Security Council to end sanctions against Iraq.
S1M-1850 Effect of Sanctions Against Iraq (lodged on 20 April 2001) Andrew Wilson*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Donald Gorrie*, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-1850 Effect of Sanctions Against Iraq (lodged on 20 April 2001) Michael Matheson*, Robin Harper*
S1M-1850 Effect of Sanctions Against Iraq (lodged on 20 April 2001) Mr Adam Ingram*, Elaine Smith*, Mr John McAllion*, Tommy Sheridan*, Cathy Peattie*

S1M-1850 Pauline McNeill: Effect of Sanctions Against Iraq—That the Parliament notes the Amnesty International Report which states that sanctions imposed against Iraq by the UN Security Council in 1990 have crippled Iraq's economic infrastructure, increased unemployment, raised malnutrition and mortality levels and caused widespread corruption throughout Iraqi society; further notes UNICEF estimates that sanctions have contributed to the deaths of approximately 500,000 children under the age of 5 since 1990, and calls on the UN Security Council to end sanctions against Iraq. Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Mr Michael McMahon, Donald Gorrie, Tricia Marwick, Michael Matheson, Robin Harper, Mr Adam Ingram, Elaine Smith, Mr John McAllion, Tommy Sheridan, Cathy Peattie, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1850 Effect of Sanctions Against Iraq (lodged on 20 April 2001) Brian Adam*
S1M-1850 Effect of Sanctions Against Iraq (lodged on 20 April 2001) Christine Grahame*, Cathy Jamieson*
S1M-1850 Effect of Sanctions Against Iraq (lodged on 20 April 2001) Mr Gil Paterson*, Trish Godman*

Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Mr Michael McMahon, Donald Gorrie, Tricia Marwick, Michael Matheson, Robin Harper, Mr Adam Ingram, Elaine Smith, Mr John McAllion, Tommy Sheridan, Cathy Peattie, Linda Fabiani, Brian Adam, Christine Grahame, Cathy Jamieson, Mr Gil Paterson, Trish Godman
S1M-1850 Effect of Sanctions Against Iraq (lodged on 20 April 2001) Ms Sandra White*
